isis.stitle: HYDRO-MAX II BRAKE MONITOR SYSTEM - DESCRIPTION

svcproc.title: HYDRAULIC BRAKE WARNING MONITOR
svcproc.para: The warning monitor ( Figure 1) is a small plastic box, containing a circuit board, that is mounted inside the vehicle with two #10 screws. The monitor is connected to the brake system by way of a Packard 10-way PC board edge connector.

The monitor checks the Hydro-Max electric pump motor for continuity, and the hydraulic brake switch and the stop light switch for closure within a few seconds of each other. The monitor will then activate a warning light and alarm when a fault is detected.

The monitor also checks the position of the flow switch contacts, and activates the warning light and alarm until the switch contacts open. The monitor also checks the position of the pressure differential switch contacts and activates the warning light and alarm if a difference in pressure closes the switch contacts.

The condition of the hydraulic brake relay, its feed circuit, and its output circuit are also checked for power output to the pump motor when the brake switches, flow switch, or pressure differential switch is closed. Thus the warning light and alarm will be activated if power is not present at the motor.
